definition: qualities that make sth worth seeing (or reading)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: At this point, advertising on Bing becomes far more interesting.
sentences.chinese: 這樣一來，Bing的廣告業務便更有看頭了。

sentences.english: The game will raise the passion on both sides, it wont be dull!
sentences.chinese: 這場比賽一定會將雙方的激情都點燃，會大有看頭。

sentences.english: Obviously, a magic hat isn't worth much without a rabbit.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，魔法帽子沒有兔子就沒有看頭了。

sentences.english: Network America has to give people a reason to like you not just a reason to watch you.
sentences.chinese: 而在美國，角色不僅要有看頭，還要夠討喜。

sentences.english: Hey, this new Terminator flick just might be worth checking out after all . . .
sentences.chinese: 嘿，這部新的《終結者》可能還真的有點看頭呢。

sentences.english: This film is well worth seeing.
Other potential avenues, such as loop quantum gravity, are also proving untidy.
sentences.chinese: 另外一個有點看頭的“圈量子引力”，也還是亂糟糟。
